I could almost hear her voice trembling as she wrote, "My dearest child, remember that even in darkness, there is love." A profound sense of loneliness enveloped me; it felt like a physical presence, cold and heavy, pressing against my chest.

I leaned against the blackboard, clutching the note to my heart. My emotions were my compass, guiding me through this labyrinth of loss and longing. They told me I was alone, that no one could truly understand my pain. They whispered that happiness was a distant memory, replaced by this perpetual ache. Yet, these feelings felt real, tangible. They were my reality now.

I folded the note carefully, tucking it into my pocket like a precious artifact. It was a piece of Mom, her love for me seeping from every faded word. And in that moment, I knew—I couldn't let anyone take this pain away. It was mine to bear, my constant companion in this empty classroom and empty heart.
